pullRequest.body:
Much of the results in `Algebra.Order.Monoid.WithTop` only depend on unbundled ordered algebra instance parameters. We split those results out into a new file `Algera.Order.Monoid.Unbundled.WithTop` leaving the facts about bundled ordered monoids.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

| Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Monoid.WithTop | 178 | 197 | +19 (+10.67%) |
| Mathlib.Data.Nat.Cast.WithTop | 237 | 231 | -6 (-2.53%) |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Sub.WithTop | 201 | 198 | -3 (-1.49%) |

---

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ WithTop.linearOrderedAddCommMonoidWithTop`
`- linearOrderedAddCommMonoidWithTop`
`--++ coe_eq_ofNat`

`--++ ofNat_eq_coe`
<details>

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:

```
</details>

</details>

LGTM. Do you know why there are declarations that changed?

bprs d+

:v: mattrobball can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> LGTM. Do you know why there are declarations that changed?

I couldn't figure why these got reported. I checked they were just moved. Maybe a bug with two declarations in the same file having the same name after stripping namespaces.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore (Data.Multiset.Basic): avoid bundled ordered algebra for basic results on multisets
chore (Algebra.CharZero.Lemmas): avoid importing bundled ordered algebra
